data.content:
noun
plural ~ -ers
[count] a ride at an amusement park which is like a small, open train with tracks that are high off the ground and that have sharp curves and steep hills
We went for a ride on the roller coaster.
a roller-coaster ride
a situation or experience that involves sudden and extreme changes
The divorce was an emotional roller coaster for both of them.
He's had a roller-coaster career. [=a career with many ups and downs]
